intro: Gomphogyne nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal gomphogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
